content.description: Sit start with a good left hand edge and a right hand pinch-edge. From there, stick a right hand teardrop, reel in the feet, bump the right hand to a sloper, slap the left hand up to a great edge, bump the right to an incut edge, reach the lip, follow it slightly right, mantel on top, and finish up the slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Pasteurization's west face.

content.description: Start in the center of the south face. Move up to a big ledge about 12 feet up. From there, you can continue moving up in any sort of way.
content.location: This is the middle of the south face on the Pasteurization Block. The downclimb is on the southwest corner.

content.description: Sit start with a cobbled, juggy, incut feature. From there, pull up to the lip, then follow it right to the apex, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Pasteurization.

content.description:
Stand start with two good crimps on the right side of the southwest corner of the Pasteurization Block. From there, move up and left to a positive hold. The feet might cut, but it's a lot of fun.

From there, move up using the positive holds on the black face.
content.location: This is on the southwest corner of Pasteurization Block. The downclimb is the same area. Just find some jugs to lower yourself and hop down.

climbs.name: Always Marry a German Farm Girl

content.description:
Stand start in the center of west face of the Pasteurization Block using a positive left side pull and a TINY sloping, right hand crimp. From there, move up to the obvious rail that starts at the roof.

Once you get that, make a big move up to the lip. Your feet may cut, but it's a pretty positive hold.

From there, find a way to top out.
content.protection: Pads and a good spotter. The landing is good.
content.location: The downclimb is on the southwest corner. It's actually part of Get the Gouda but appears to be the easiest way down.
